reviews.sentence: Quiet weekend getaway. Stayed there for a birthday weekend getaway. Location is wonderful and reading on the patio overlooking the creek was very relaxing. Rooms are very nice and well insulated. We did not even know we had neighbors until we saw the complimentary newspapers in the hallway. Afternoon wine and appetizers were a nice touch. Warning Big Basin coffee down the street was delicious but the wait was ridiculous. Better to head to Starbucks 2 blocks further. Location quietness patio Great restaurants nearby and Stiletos for wine was fun. Workout room could be expanded and the stationary bicycle was broken which we mentioned to management. Warning.

Comfy room some free wine great location in low stress wealthy little town. Loved the private balcony overlooking the creek. Staff was polite — actually borderline obsequious. Overall good experience would recommend.

The Perfect Getaway. The stream nextdor had turned into a river and it was wonderful to hear it from our room. The view was beautiful and the inn was spotless. Wine and hors doeuvres at 5 and good breakfast choices. I did not like leaving.

Highly recommend. We loved our stay. I loved this place. beautiful surroundings unsay on my patio and enjoyed the creek and trees. Every staff person was super friendly and helpful. The room was spacious quiet and beds and pillows were so comfortable. that is usually a complaint I have with uncomfortableness in other places I have stayed. Very close to town with food and shops. I can not believe all this for sure h a great price.

Excellent location and wonderful amenities. The hotel is very clean and elegant with wonderful amenities. Our room was clean with a very comfortable bed soft robes and a small balcony with two chairs facing the beautiful creek. The hotel staff members were very kind and helpful. The in room coffee was delicious and the rest of the amenities were also high in quality. Lovely rooms with a beautiful view and comfortable bed. Delicious food at the Basin Rose Market and wine tasting at Cinnabar. it is a quick walk to Hakone Gardens and a short drive to Villa Montalvo. The breakfast pastries and bread were stale. If the quality of the breakfast could be improved this would be a 5star hotel.

Great value at twice the price. Very fair price no charge for parking comfortable bed huge bathroom close to town next to park. My best hotel stay in a long timealthough parking is free spots were a bit narrow for my truck its a bigger pick up.
The Inn was a great place in the heart of a town with a lot of character. Right next to a park closet to Santa Cruz mountains and easy access to downtown.
Very nice historic hotel in a crowded charming city but do n’t feel crowded at all. Staff very nice and helpful. Rooms are clean and excellent view of brook in the back from our room.

Stayed in the suite. Would highly recommend it. Patio view of the creek. Benches and park just outside of the hotel. I stayed overnight for a friend ’s wedding in Saratoga. It would have been great if I stayed for another night to explore. I would highly recommend this place.
Really nice room and nice location. Out doors patio positioned on a beautiful Creek bed and breakfast was provided. Easy access to downtown plenty of parking and nice staff.
Ok but should discount rooms during construction. New furnishings. Construction. Mess and smell.

They are undergoing a remodel and rightfully so. The room was a muted decor with a leather recliner that had some patch work from tears. There was a small balcony with one chair and scaffolding around the entire building. The parking lot had storage containers and the construction crew vehicles dominated the parking lot. there is not any real amenities at this location. I recommend staying elsewhere. Also I have stayed at places that say they are under construction this place is really UNDER CONSTRUCTION. Check in is on the 4th floor inside a suite. there is no lobby.

Good. Great bed very comfortable. Love the view of the Creek however there was scaffolding blocking that during the renovation. Confusion as to entry and parking due to renovation that is in progress.

i Would definitely stay here again because of the excellent staff Location and lovely setting. The place was undergoing renovation so there was construction going on that was a little more extensive than we had anticipated but the staff were super accommodating and our accommodations clean with a lovely view of trees and a creek. The location is terrific close to just about everything restaurants and the historical museum. We were told in advance about the construction going on so there were no surprises except the extent of the work.

It is unfair right now to be too hard on this hotel. They are undergoing a large renovation and continuing to operate as normal. Lobby is in a conference room. Hall are full of construction materials. On a more consistent note the continental breakfast is average. There are few amenities at this property no terrace pool or for now meeting room.

Fantastic Overall. It was during construction but the new rooms are fantastic and the sound from the creek was so wonderful after a very stressful week. Beds are superb. Immaculately clean. Only downside aside from construction was shower pressure.

The hotel was undergoing renovations which I was not aware of when I booked my reservation. The excercise room was not available and dust and construction on much of the premises. The free breakfast consisted of cold cereal unripe pears and small not very appetizing muffins. If you can not provide a decent breakfast you should not offer it.

Fantastic place for a romantic get away as soon as its finished. The location is awesomeif your looking for a nice quiet place and beautiful town. The creek adds an extra peaceful touch. Well it is still going through a major remodel and you have to walk through unfinished areas to get to your room. And some of the amenities are not available as they should be.

The worst experience I have had staying in Santa Clara. Booked online called to confirm arrival time hours in advance called for 30 mins while driving to confirm the room was ready nobody answered after 5 call attempts arrived at check in the entire place was under renovations and wayfinding to the front desk was misleading. No room was ready staff was very unhelpful and wasted 90minutes for nothing. Chargeback in progress DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME. The entire property is under construction and the elevator was being used to haul drywall and renovations crew between floors. Extremely unprofessional and not worth more than a Motel 6.

Disappointed. My stay was good untilI got home and saw I had been charged for two additional rooms that had not been in a previous booking by hotelscom. I had modified the booking and only had 3 rooms when I checked in. Then later found out there were 2 more in error. The hotel charged me rooms with a card not previously authorized and has now not responded to my emails to refund the chargesThis stay was for my wedding weekend and I am now sad because it was beautiful and I am unsure I will stay there again.
